caption.title: Carbon isotope fractionation values (Δ leaf) vs. [CO 2] for Thuja and growth chamber dicots.
caption.p: Δ leaf vs. [CO 2] for Thuja and dicots. Shown are Thuja occidentalis (black empty triangles; Δ leaf = 0.0029([CO 2]) + 17.04, R 2 = 0.0085) and Schubert & Jahren’s (2012) growth chamber studies with replicates of Raphanus sativus and Arabidopsis thaliana (black and grey smooth lines). Schubert & Jahren’s data shows C 3 specimens growing at 15 levels of [CO 2] from 370 to 4,200 ppm.
